name: .XP File Extension
summary: Learn about .XP files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: An XP file is a song pattern created by Triton Fasttracker 2, an audio tracker for MS-DOS. It stores a pattern, which consists of multiple rows (64 by default and 1,024 maximum) divided into columns configuring aspects of the note (instrument used, volume setting, effects, etc.). Fasttracker 2 users can arrange patterns in XP files with other patterns to create a complete song, or .XM module.

content: Fasttracker 2, or Fasttracker II, is an audio tracker designed for creating music. You can arrange patterns (stored in XP files) along a master timeline to create a sequence that makes up a song.
Titon Productions is a Swedish start-up that developed and released Fasttracker 2 in November 1994. The company developed the software through version 2.08, releasing it in August 1997.

instructions: You can open an XP file with Triton Fasttracker 2 in Windows.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
